ingredients.name: chanterelle mushrooms, cleaned and roughly chopped
fresh thyme leaves, plus more for garnish

steps.description: Melt the butter in a large cast-iron pan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook, stirring, until softened but not browned, about 1 minute.

Add the chanterelles and stir to coat with the butter. Cook, stirring frequently, until most of the moisture has evaporated and the mushrooms are softened, about 8 minutes. Add the thyme and salt, stir to combine, then remove the pan from the heat.

While the chanterelles cook, spread the olive oil on a baking pan and lay the bread on the pan, flipping once to coat both sides. Toast in the oven until lightly golden on top, about 10 minutes, then flip and toast another 10 minutes.
Top each slice of bread with a scoop of the chanterelles. Garnish with extra thyme leaves and serve warm.
